definition.name: release-please-action
definition.description: automated releases based on conventional commits
definition.author: Google LLC

inputs.name: token
inputs.description: GitHub token for creating and grooming release PRs, defaults to using secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN

inputs.name: release-type
inputs.description: what type of release is this, one of (ruby, python, node, terraform-module)

inputs.name: path
inputs.description: create a release from a path other than the repository's root

inputs.name: target-branch
inputs.description: branch to open pull release PR against (detected by default)

inputs.name: config-file
inputs.description: where can the config file be found in the project?

inputs.name: manifest-file
inputs.description: where can the manifest file be found in the project?

inputs.name: fork
inputs.description: If true, send the PR from a fork. This requires the token to be a user that can create forks (e.g. not the default GITHUB_TOKEN)

inputs.name: include-component-in-tag
inputs.description: If true, add prefix to tags and branches, allowing multiple libraries to be released from the same repository

inputs.name: proxy-server
inputs.description: set proxy sever when you run this action behind a proxy. format is host:port e.g. proxy-host.com:8080

inputs.name: skip-github-release
inputs.description: if set to true, then do not try to tag releases

inputs.name: skip-github-pull-request
inputs.description: if set to true, then do not try to open pull requests

inputs.name: changelog-host
inputs.description: The proto://host where commits live. Default `https://github.com`
